Description: Terracotta model of trophy of arms. A model of a trophy of arms, with a rectangular-sectioned stem. The top is broken away and below the break, in relief, is a body cuirass and a short tunic above a pair of greaves. Almost solid; two-piece mould. Fired in a reducing atmosphere: brown-grey Nile silt, with some mica, covered with a black slip, probably the so-called Memphis Black Ware.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3287)
Condition: The bottom of the stem has a rounded tenon for insertion into something, and is now damaged.
